Package codeContext.processors

Class ASTContextInjector

java.lang.Object
codeContext.processors.ASTContextInjector
public class ASTContextInjector extends Object
Manages context injection into AST
Author:
Jakub Perdek

    static int
    injectContextForStatements(GlobalContext globalContext, InnerContext usedInnerContext, org.json.simple.JSONArray parentArrayObject, int position, org.json.simple.JSONObject newVersionProcessedJSONObject)
    Injects the context for statements field including both variability types - the positive and negative variability -the negative variability can be processed only if annotations can be put on object thus object newVersionProcessedJSONObject is not null

    Injects negative variability context for parameter - injects the decorator/annotation for parameter -generates annotation/decorates function/constructor parameter on given position

    Injects the negative variability context for statements field
    static org.json.simple.JSONObject
    injectPositiveVariabilityContextForMembers(GlobalContext globalContext, InnerContext usedInnerContext, org.json.simple.JSONArray parentArrayObject, int position)
    Injects the positive variability context for members -generates all possible calls of available/reachable functionality from processed script -generates more descriptive inner representation of data on variation point from actual inner context if VariationPointDivisionConfiguration.LONG_CONTEXT_PRINT is set to true -generates descriptive representation from global context -generates positive variation point marker with all relevant/associated data in JSON format and inserts it into AST
    static int
    injectPositiveVariabilityContextForStatements(GlobalContext globalContext, InnerContext usedInnerContext, org.json.simple.JSONArray parentArrayObject, int position)
    Injects the positive variability variation point context for statements field -generates all possible calls of available/reachable functionality from processed script -generates more descriptive inner representation of data on variation point from actual inner context if VariationPointDivisionConfiguration.LONG_CONTEXT_PRINT is set to true -generates descriptive representation from global context -generates positive variation point marker with all relevant/associated data in JSON format and inserts it into AST
    static int
    injectPositiviveVariabilityContextForParameters(org.json.simple.JSONArray parentArrayObject, int position)
    Injects the positive variability context for parameters -generates positive variability function/constructor parameter in the position between function/constructor parameters or also on margins

  • Constructor Details

    • ASTContextInjector

      public ASTContextInjector()

  • Method Details

    • injectContextForStatements

      public static int injectContextForStatements(GlobalContext globalContext, InnerContext usedInnerContext, org.json.simple.JSONArray parentArrayObject, int position, org.json.simple.JSONObject newVersionProcessedJSONObject) throws IOException, InterruptedException, DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint, DuplicatedAnnotation
      Injects the context for statements field including both variability types - the positive and negative variability -the negative variability can be processed only if annotations can be put on object thus object newVersionProcessedJSONObject is not null
      Parameters:
      globalContext - - global context - accessible in all places (such as variables declared as var in JavaScript)
      usedInnerContext - - actual/processed inner context in the hierarchy of inner contexts
      parentArrayObject - - the parent JSON array where the positive variability marker (variable/parameter) is going to be inserted on the given position
      position - - the position where context should be injected in statements array
      newVersionProcessedJSONObject - - new version of processed JSON object
      Returns:
      1 if VariationPointDivisionConfiguration.ALLOW_POSITIVE_VARIABILITY is set to true otherwise 0
      Throws:
      IOException - - the exception for various problems with file loading
      InterruptedException - - the exception thrown during interruption
      DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint - - the exception capturing different annotation types on the same variation point
      DuplicatedAnnotation - - the exception capturing duplicated annotation that is found on AST

    • injectPositiveVariabilityContextForStatements

      public static int injectPositiveVariabilityContextForStatements(GlobalContext globalContext, InnerContext usedInnerContext, org.json.simple.JSONArray parentArrayObject, int position) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Injects the positive variability variation point context for statements field -generates all possible calls of available/reachable functionality from processed script -generates more descriptive inner representation of data on variation point from actual inner context if VariationPointDivisionConfiguration.LONG_CONTEXT_PRINT is set to true -generates descriptive representation from global context -generates positive variation point marker with all relevant/associated data in JSON format and inserts it into AST
      Parameters:
      globalContext - - global context - accessible in all places (such as variables declared as var in JavaScript)
      usedInnerContext - - actual/processed inner context in the hierarchy of inner contexts
      parentArrayObject - - the parent JSON array where the positive variability marker (non-class variable) is going to be inserted on the given position
      position - - the position in JSON array where the positive variability marker (non-class variable) should be inserted
      Returns:
      1 if VariationPointDivisionConfiguration.ALLOW_POSITIVE_VARIABILITY is set to true otherwise 0
      Throws:
      IOException - - the exception for various problems with file loading
      InterruptedException - - the exception thrown during interruption

    • injectNegativeVariabilityContextForStatements

      public static void injectNegativeVariabilityContextForStatements(GlobalContext globalContext, InnerContext usedInnerContext, org.json.simple.JSONObject newVersionProcessedJSONObject) throws IOException, InterruptedException, DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint, DuplicatedAnnotation
      Injects the negative variability context for statements field
      Parameters:
      globalContext - - global context - accessible in all places (such as variables declared as var in JavaScript)
      usedInnerContext - - actual/processed inner context in the hierarchy of inner contexts
      newVersionProcessedJSONObject - - new version of processed JSON object
      Throws:
      IOException - - the exception for various problems with file loading
      InterruptedException - - the exception thrown during interruption
      DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint - - the exception capturing different annotation types on the same variation point
      DuplicatedAnnotation - - the exception capturing duplicated annotation that is found on AST

    • injectNegativeVariabilityContextForMembersBetweenParentAndArrayMember

      public static void injectNegativeVariabilityContextForMembersBetweenParentAndArrayMember(GlobalContext globalContext, InnerContext usedInnerContext, org.json.simple.JSONObject newVersionProcessedJSONObject, org.json.simple.JSONObject parentAstObject, org.json.simple.JSONObject insertedVPElement) throws IOException, InterruptedException, DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint, DuplicatedAnnotation
      Injects the negative variability context for members field
      Parameters:
      globalContext - - global context - accessible in all places (such as variables declared as var in JavaScript)
      usedInnerContext - - actual/processed inner context in the hierarchy of inner contexts
      newVersionProcessedJSONObject - - new version of processed JSON object
      parentAstObject - - the parent of actually processed AST part/object
      insertedVPElement - - inserted variation point element
      Throws:
      IOException - - the exception for various problems with file loading
      InterruptedException - - the exception thrown during interruption
      DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint - - the exception capturing different annotation types on the same variation point
      DuplicatedAnnotation - - the exception capturing duplicated annotation that is found on AST

    • injectNegativeVariabilityContextForMembers

      public static void injectNegativeVariabilityContextForMembers(GlobalContext globalContext, InnerContext usedInnerContext, org.json.simple.JSONObject newVersionProcessedJSONObject, org.json.simple.JSONObject parentAstObject) throws IOException, InterruptedException, DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint, DuplicatedAnnotation
      Injects the negative variability context for members -processes annotations for class -processes annotations for class functions
      Parameters:
      globalContext - - global context - accessible in all places (such as variables declared as var in JavaScript)
      usedInnerContext - - actual/processed inner context in the hierarchy of inner contexts
      newVersionProcessedJSONObject - - new version of processed JSON object
      parentAstObject - - the parent of actually processed AST part/object
      Throws:
      IOException - - the exception for various problems with file loading
      InterruptedException - - the exception thrown during interruption
      DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint - - the exception capturing different annotation types on the same variation point
      DuplicatedAnnotation - - the exception capturing duplicated annotation that is found on AST

    • injectContextForMembers

      public static org.json.simple.JSONObject injectContextForMembers(GlobalContext globalContext, InnerContext usedInnerContext, org.json.simple.JSONArray parentArrayObject, int position) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Injects positive variability context for members -injects positive variation point marker in the place between elements of members array or on margins
      Parameters:
      globalContext - - global context - accessible in all places (such as variables declared as var in JavaScript)
      usedInnerContext - - actual/processed inner context in the hierarchy of inner contexts
      parentArrayObject - - the parent JSON array where the positive variability marker (class variable) is going to be inserted on the given position
      position - - the position in JSON array where the positive variability marker (class variable) should be inserted
      Returns:
      created marker appended to members array if VariationPointDivisionConfiguration.ALLOW_POSITIVE_VARIABILITY is set to true otherwise null
      Throws:
      IOException - - the exception for various problems with file loading
      InterruptedException - - the exception thrown during interruption

    • injectPositiveVariabilityContextForMembers

      public static org.json.simple.JSONObject injectPositiveVariabilityContextForMembers(GlobalContext globalContext, InnerContext usedInnerContext, org.json.simple.JSONArray parentArrayObject, int position) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Injects the positive variability context for members -generates all possible calls of available/reachable functionality from processed script -generates more descriptive inner representation of data on variation point from actual inner context if VariationPointDivisionConfiguration.LONG_CONTEXT_PRINT is set to true -generates descriptive representation from global context -generates positive variation point marker with all relevant/associated data in JSON format and inserts it into AST
      Parameters:
      globalContext - - global context - accessible in all places (such as variables declared as var in JavaScript)
      usedInnerContext - - actual/processed inner context in the hierarchy of inner contexts
      parentArrayObject - - the parent JSON array where the positive variability marker (class variable) is going to be inserted on the given position
      position - - the position in JSON array where the positive variability marker (class variable) should be inserted
      Returns:
      created marker appended to members array if VariationPointDivisionConfiguration.ALLOW_POSITIVE_VARIABILITY is set to true otherwise null
      Throws:
      IOException - - the exception for various problems with file loading
      InterruptedException - - the exception thrown during interruption

    • injectPositiviveVariabilityContextForParameters

      public static int injectPositiviveVariabilityContextForParameters(org.json.simple.JSONArray parentArrayObject, int position) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Injects the positive variability context for parameters -generates positive variability function/constructor parameter in the position between function/constructor parameters or also on margins
      Parameters:
      parentArrayObject - - the parent JSON array where the positive variability parameter is going to be inserted on the given position
      position - - the position where positive variability function/constructor parameter is going to be inserted
      Returns:
      1 if VariationPointDivisionConfiguration.ALLOW_POSITIVE_VARIABILITY and VariationPointDivisionConfiguration.GENERATE_ALL_FUNCTION_PARAMETERS otherwise 0
      Throws:
      IOException - - the exception for various problems with file loading
      InterruptedException - - the exception thrown during interruption

    • injectNegativeVariabilityContextForParameters

      public static void injectNegativeVariabilityContextForParameters(GlobalContext globalContext, InnerContext usedInnerContext, org.json.simple.JSONArray parentArrayObject, int position, org.json.simple.JSONObject newVersionProcessedJSONObject, org.json.simple.JSONObject parentAstObject) throws IOException, InterruptedException, DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint, DuplicatedAnnotation
      Injects negative variability context for parameter - injects the decorator/annotation for parameter -generates annotation/decorates function/constructor parameter on given position
      Parameters:
      globalContext - - global context - accessible in all places (such as variables declared as var in JavaScript)
      usedInnerContext - - actual/processed inner context in the hierarchy of inner contexts
      parentArrayObject - - the parent JSON array where the actual parameter (negative variability) is going to be annotated on the given position
      position - - the position where negative variability annotation for parameter is going to be injected
      newVersionProcessedJSONObject - - new version of processed JSON object
      parentAstObject - - the parent of actually processed AST part/object
      Throws:
      IOException - - the exception for various problems with file loading
      InterruptedException - - the exception thrown during interruption
      DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint - - the exception capturing different annotation types on the same variation point
      DuplicatedAnnotation - - the exception capturing duplicated annotation that is found on AST

    • injectContextForParameters

      public static int injectContextForParameters(GlobalContext globalContext, InnerContext usedInnerContext, org.json.simple.JSONArray parentArrayObject, int position, org.json.simple.JSONObject newVersionProcessedJSONObject, org.json.simple.JSONObject parentAstObject) throws IOException, InterruptedException, DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint, DuplicatedAnnotation
      Injects the context for parameter -both variability types are supported -positive variability -negative variability
      Parameters:
      globalContext - - global context - accessible in all places (such as variables declared as var in JavaScript)
      usedInnerContext - - actual/processed inner context in the hierarchy of inner contexts
      parentArrayObject - - the parent JSON array where the positive variability marker (function/constructor parameter) is going to be inserted on the given position
      position - - the position in JSON array where the positive variability marker (function/constructor parameter) should be inserted
      newVersionProcessedJSONObject - - new version of processed JSON object
      parentAstObject - - the parent of actually processed AST part/object
      Returns:
      1 if VariationPointDivisionConfiguration.ALLOW_POSITIVE_VARIABILITY and VariationPointDivisionConfiguration.GENERATE_ALL_FUNCTION_PARAMETERS otherwise 0
      Throws:
      IOException - - the exception for various problems with file loading
      InterruptedException - - the exception thrown during interruption
      DifferentAnnotationTypesOnTheSameVariationPoint - - the exception capturing different annotation types on the same variation point
      DuplicatedAnnotation - - the exception capturing duplicated annotation that is found on AST
